results.title: Buttercup
results.creator_credit: Robert Leland Brown and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: This film presents without commentary an ecological story about a buttercup which floats down a mountain stream and ends up being swallowed in polluted industrial waters. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Busy bodies
results.brief_description: Discusses how exercise and movement contribute to good health and physical condition. Shows characteristic movement of a variety of animals, followed by children imitating those movements. Narrated by Vic Perrin. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Bustin
results.brief_description: Internet comedy and meme-generator extraordinaire Neil Cicierega (Potter Puppet Pals) creates a video / audio remix of Ray Parker Jnr’s classic film theme that isn’t soon forgotten.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

results.title: Business activity statement : your one report
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the new Business Activity Statement (BAS), introduced with the Goods and Services Tax. It includes examples showing how to complete a BAS. Presented by Michael Caton.

results.title: Bushman
results.brief_description: Discusses the timber industry in New Zealand including tree felling, the process of timber cutting to manufacturing and the lives of workers and their wives.

results.title: Bushfires: your safety and survival
results.brief_description: Made especially for television information purposes, this film is introduced by Sir Henry Bolte, (Premier of Victoria in 1969). It tells how to prevent, prepare against, and fight bush fires. It also explains how to defend your home, property and life when fire threatens.

results.title: Bushed
results.creator_credit: Steve French and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An animated story about a displaced Aboriginal who meets a misplaced kangaroo. Together they “travel the bush of Australia like true-born native men”. But the bush has changed and they discover that “you can’t go home again”.

results.title: Bushcraft
results.brief_description: Before setting out on a camping trip, careful planning is necessary. The film demonstrates the choice of equipment, the proper food and clothing required and how a rucksack should be packed. For the trip itself, other hints include the various ways to cross a river, finding the route, marking the trail, building a fire and the correct handling of firearms.

results.title: Bush Mechanics animation (2015)
results.brief_description: In the central Australian desert, four Warlpiri men travel to visit a powerful elder at a remote outstation. On the road they must overcome mechanical mishaps and the trickery of a mischievous spirit. It will take all of their bush ingenuity to keep their car running and themselves alive.

constellations_other.name: Culture and identity on the Australian screen
constellations_other.description: Australian screen culture is distinctive, unexpected, playful and serious when it matters. Indigenous productions make a huge contribution to the unique identity of the Australian moving image.

results.title: Bush Christmas
results.creator_credit: Ralph Smart, ABFD and Children's Entertainment Films
results.brief_description: This brilliant Australian film depicts Yuletide life in country Australia in the 1940s. A family of children, whose father owns a horse farm, realise the horses have been stolen, so they set out to track the horse thieves in an effort to return the horses to their father as a Christmas present. A storm destroys their tracks and the children become lost, while search parties, and the horse thieves, one of which is played by Chips Rafferty, desperately hunt for them. This is a superb film which won critical acclaim around the world upon its release, and is regarded as an Australian classic. Narrated by John McCallum and filmed on location in the Blue Mountains and Burragorang Valley. Cast includes: John Fernside, Stan Tolhurst, Helen Grieve, Nicky Yardly, Edmund Allison.
